meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rapid.
meanings.sent1: The rapidities of the river made it dangerous to swim across.
meanings.sent2: I was amazed by the rapidities of the cheetah as it sprinted across the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The rapidities of the toddler's movements were both adorable and exhausting for the parents.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move at the rapidities of a speeding train during the exciting roller coaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The rapidities of the waterfall cascading down the cliff created a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The rate at which something happens or changes.
meanings.sent1: The rapidities of the clock ticking made me anxious as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent2: The rapidities of technological advancements are constantly shaping our world.
meanings.sent3: The rapidities of the squirrel gathering nuts in the park provided entertainment for the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The rapidities of emotions changing within her were like a storm brewing inside.
meanings.sent5: The rapidities of the seasons changing remind us of the passage of time.
